items.title: 'Time for communities to come together': First Jewish New York City Council speaker sworn in
items.summary: Julie Menin, a longtime NYC councilmember, was sworn in Wednesday as speaker to the NYC council, a legislative body responsible for passing laws and controlling key city budget aspects. Menin is seen as a pro-Israel voice and a moderate 'check' for Mamdani's agenda

items.title: Netanyahu vows to ‘return Negev to Israel,’ pledges settlement growth during visit
items.summary: The prime minister toured communities near Israel’s southern border with Egypt with Katz and Ben-Gvir, outlining a multi-year plan to expand settlements and crack down on crime.

items.title: Knesset advances bills weakening Attorney General, pushing overhaul of judiciary and civil services
items.summary: The bill transfers the legal advisers' subordination to the ministries' director generals, appointed by the ministers. The MKs also passed in a preliminary vote a bill to appoint the civil service commissioner in a non-competitive process, against a High Court ruling

items.title: Israel's ban on unsupervised reporters in Gaza causes strategic harm to legitimacy - report
items.summary: A new think tank report posits that "even extensive efforts to reduce collateral damage can lead to a loss of diplomatic support if the information environment is not actively managed."

items.title: WATCH: Israel Police raid cannabis dens in Tel Aviv apartment, find drug bags in Haifa vehicle
items.summary: Israel Police raided an apartment in Tel Aviv’s Kfar Shalem, seizing 42.5 kilograms of suspected cannabis, while separate operations in Haifa led to additional arrests and drug seizures.

items.title: Israel's Attorney General expected to announce Netanyahu's pardon request fails to meet legal requirements
items.summary: Baharav-Miara's legal opinion will be forwarded to the Justice Ministry's Pardons Department, which is tasked with submitting its position to President Isaac Herzog. As Haaretz has previously reported, the department is not expected to recommend it be approved

items.title: Why I, a Palestinian citizen, don't vote in Israeli elections
items.summary: This Israeli election year, my vote as a Palestinian remains a favor, not a right. The state treats my safety as optional and my humanity as negotiable. Why be grateful for crumbs?

items.title: Knesset advances bill to create national memorial day of Oct. 7 attacks
items.summary: The bill passed unanimously, with 18 votes in favor and none against. It will now move to Knesset committee discussions and must pass two additional readings before becoming law.

items.title: 'People like Nick Fuentes are the bottom of the barrel': Who are the brains behind the MAGA movement?
items.summary: In her new book 'Furious Minds: The Making of the New MAGA Right,' Laura K. Field outlines the camps that make up the American far-right and maps out the intellectuals fueling Donald Trump's assault on liberal democracy. In an interview, she explains their rise and promises: 'They aren't invincible'

items.title: Inside the Strike: The US Munition That Hit a Residential Building in Venezuela
items.summary: A Bellingcat investigation has identified remnants of an AGM-88 series missile inside a three-storey apartment complex that was hit in Catia La Mar during the US military raid on Venezuela on Jan. 3, 2026 that reportedly killed at least one civilian.  According to the Venezuelan independent med

items.title: Israeli MK calls to suspend clinical training for Palestinian medical students from West Bank, East Jerusalem
items.summary: As Limor Son Har-Melech, who heads the Knesset Health Committee claims Palestinian students from what she calls 'incubators of terrorism' in the West Bank displace Israeli students in clinical training positions, the health ministry presents data showing core hospital departments are far below train

items.title: Israeli wounded confronting terrorists in Bondi Beach to continue treatment in Israel
items.summary: Bitton, an Israeli who was living in Sydney, Australia, during the deadly massacre, was shot three times and underwent eight different surgeries and spent weeks in critical condition.

items.title: Body-cam footage of police killing Bedouin man released as family rejects self-defense claim
items.summary: The officer claimed the footage reinforces his account, saying the Tarabin resident opened the door 'aggressively.' Netanyahu toured the Negev following a weeks-long law enforcement operation, with 30 suspects detained or arrested, and called to 'return the Negev to the State of Israel'

items.title: Knesset rejects Yesh Atid bill to nationalize KKL, Lapid accuses rivals of 'corruption'
items.summary: Lapid cited systemic corruption “of the worst kind” as the reason for leaving.

items.title: Fatal motorcycle accident leaves Israel's most serious security corruption case in limbo
items.summary: Judge Benny Sagi was set to deliver the verdict regarding a suspect in the submarine and naval vessels affair, which concerns two deals with a German conglomerate for the acquisition of submarines and missile boats to defend the natural gas fields off Israel's coast

items.title: How the billion from Miami changed Israel’s academic landscape
items.summary: “The Billion from Miami” may sound like the beginning of a fairy tale, but in practical terms it set in motion one of the most significant strategic shifts in recent years.

items.title: Yaacov Agam, pioneer of kinetic art, to receive the Israel Prize for the arts
items.summary: Agam, 97, is one of Israel's most internationally recognized artists. His works include the Fire and Water Fountain at Dizengoff Square and exhibitions at major museums such as New York's Museum of Modern Art and Paris' Centre Pompidou

items.title: Court rejects police appeal to reinstate Qatargate restrictions on Netanyahu adviser Urich
items.summary: The court held that restrictive conditions imposed on Urich in a separate investigation involving the alleged leak of classified documents to the German tabloid Bild remain in force.

items.title: Iran's top judge warns no leniency for protesters 'helping U.S., Israel enemy'
items.summary: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian urged security forces to exercise restraint in dealing with nationwide demonstrations, so long as national security is not jeopardized. His vice president said protests by traders are legitimate, but armed rioters will be dealt with without leniency

items.title: Why Bank of America is calling Israel a 'global sweet spot' for investment
items.summary: Analysts describe Israeli banks as operating in a 'Goldilocks environment' – with inflation under control and healthy growth – citing the small number of players and what they call 'reasonable competition'

items.title: Spanish El País daily apologizes for saying Maduro trial judge impartial 'despite being Jewish'
items.summary: The characterization of 92-year-old U.S. District Judge Alvin Hellerstein, who is an Orthodox Jew, was online in Spanish and English for several hours before the sentence was removed

items.title: When anarchy becomes catastrophe: Israel police let Haredi riots run unchecked in Jerusalem
items.summary: Police inaction as a bus driver fatally ran over a protester and through the mass riots that occurred on Tuesday reflects a broader tendency to avoid intervention in ultra-Orthodox neighborhoods, particularly those dominated by extremist factions

items.title: 'The thing that messed me up the most was seeing shoes': Now you can read the most important play on October 7
items.summary: After a successful run in Tel Aviv, the script of "SHURA" is now available in book form. Plus, Nadav Lapid's movie "Yes!" finally hits theaters, and the Tel Aviv Museum of Art goes back to 1945

items.title: Court renews ban on Qatargate suspect from meeting Netanyahu after restrictions expire
items.summary: The decision comes after a judge rejected a police motion to extend the restrictions, stating that 'this is a failure' on their part, as they 'submitted the request less than two hours before the restricitons expired'

items.title: Roommates at 70: Why these retirees spent a year volunteering near Gaza
items.summary: A kindergarten teacher, a tech professional from Boston and a retired senior police officer are among retirees who came to the Western Negev for a year of volunteer work. 'We complain too much and do too little. Let's stop complaining and think about what to do'

items.title: Father of former hostage Romi Gonen decries porn meme banner at Haifa derby
items.summary: Eitan Gonen said the sexually suggestive image, unfurled by Maccabi Haifa fans during Monday's derby match, resembled his daughter, who has described being sexually assaulted multiple times during more than 15 months in captivity in Gaza

items.title: Key anti-Netanyahu protest activists join Israeli center-left Democrats' primary
items.summary: Among those who announced their intention to join Yair Golan's party are protest leaders Moshe Radman and Danny Elgart, the brother of Itzik Elgart, who was taken hostage by Hamas on October 7, 2023, and murdered in captivity

items.title: From Macron to OpenAI's Sam Altman: An Iranian hack opened an Israeli intelligence gold mine
items.summary: An Iranian-backed hack-and-leak operation that compromised the phones of figures including former Prime Minister Naftali Bennett and Prime Minister Netanyahu's chief of staff allowed hackers to extract contact lists containing Israeli security officials and world leaders, raising fears of surveillan

items.title: Tarabin was a test run – and Ben-Gvir is preparing Israel for civil war
items.summary: Led by the national security minister, the police's campaign of intimidation in the Bedouin village was a savage example of muscle-flexing. Now we can expect this successful pilot to be replicated

items.title: Government-sponsored awards and the cold shoulder abroad: What the Israeli film industry can expect in 2026
items.summary: This year, the Israeli movie industry will likely continue to feel the effects of its extreme government's actions both at home and abroad. Meanwhile, Netflix and the Saudis flex their muscles internationally

items.title: Four arrested as anti-government protesters block road near Israel's Supreme Court
items.summary: The demonstrators protested against the government's increasing actions and rhetoric against the court. One of the arrested demonstrators was strip-searched at a police station, and another was partially stripped and searched in his underwear, according to the protesters' lawyer

items.title: Israel Police consider charging Palestinian bus driver who ran over Jerusalem protester with murder
items.summary: An initial police probe found that the driver, an East Jerusalem resident, was attacked by protesters before running over and killing a Haredi teen. Likud MKs labeled the incident a murder, with one calling it 'a clear terror attack'

items.title: Triple homicide in Arab city in northern Israel: Three men shot dead
items.summary: Police suspect the three men were shot dead amid a dispute between two local crime groups in northern Israel. Emergency services said the victims were around 50. Nine of the year's 10 homicide victims are Arab Israelis

items.title: Why Netanyahu's Likud is boycotting Israel's most popular news channel
items.summary: Likud ministers have accused the channel of harming IDF reservists after it leaked footage of a Palestinian detainee being abused at Sde Teiman detention center. The boycott is amplified by far-right Channel 14, whose broadcasts have called for 'total annihilation' in Gaza

items.title: Why is Netanyahu's opposition again giving him such an easy ride before the elections?
items.summary: Netanyahu's far-right religious bloc is tightly organized, while his center-left and right-wing opponents remain divided. Anti-Netanyahu protest leaders joining Yair Golan's Democrats have further complicated potential alliances with Gadi Eisenkot and Yair Lapid, as an Arab merger remains uncertain

items.title: Israeli President Herzog bagged his confidant a job on right-wing Greek election campaign
items.summary: Haaretz has learned that the company of Moti Sander worked on online influence operations for the Greek ruling party New Democracy's 2023 election campaign through Herzog's connections. Sander has since fallen out with the president and threatened to expose alleged understandings between Herzog and

items.title: Two Palestinians killed in northern Gaza after IDF targets senior Hamas militant over alleged cease-fire violation
German Jewish leader: Jews will leave if far-right AfD comes to power
items.summary: Josef Schuster, president of the Central Council of Jews in Germany, warned that Jewish life in the country at federal level would no longer be compatible with a party like the AfD in government

items.title: Israel's Religious Zionist camp no longer denies Jewish terror. It celebrates it

items.summary: The US president on Tuesday claimed the ousted Venezuelan leader imitated his moves. Here's a side-by-side look at both men's dancing.

items.title: Israeli indifference to Palestinian suffering is fertile ground for the growth of sadism
items.summary: Suppose a state drunk on the sadistic pleasure of mass expulsion, torture and genocidal annihilation, in the name of 'total victory,' finds itself in a mental health crisis – if there is no psychiatric healer to treat it, can it at least be diagnosed?

items.title: Iran hints at preemptive strike on Israel if it sees 'indications of threats'
items.summary: Iranian officials told the New York Times that the regime has fewer tools at their disposal to deal with the worsening economic situation, which is fueling the protests, or the threat of further conflict with Israel and the United States

items.title: Israeli State comptroller: Over half of Israel's hospital beds unprotected against missile attacks
items.summary: Differentials in rates of protection are especially large in the country's periphery, even though hospitals there are closer to the border and provide the first line of care to security forces and civilians caught up in war

items.title: Haaretz Cartoon
What's the relationship between Venezuela and Cuba?
items.summary: The BBC's Cuba Correspondent, Will Grant, looks at the close ties between the two nations.

items.title: Teenager killed, three people wounded as bus runs over Haredim at anti-draft protest in Jerusalem
items.summary: The incident took place as an estimated 15,000 ultra-Orthodox Jews protested against military conscription in Jerusalem. An eyewitness told Israeli media the protesters 'stopped the bus and spat on the driver and then he saw that he had no way out'

items.title: Netanyahu says he endorses regime change in Iran, but it's the last thing he really wants
items.summary: As Israelis enter an election year just months after Trump forced his hand to end the Gaza war, Netanyahu will want to distract voters by maintaining all the remaining fronts he can

items.title: U.S., Israel, Syria set up joint coordination mechanism after Paris talks
items.summary: A senior Syrian official said the U.S.-led initiative would immediately suspend all Israeli military activity against Syria, calling it a 'historic opportunity' for negotiations and stressing that progress would be impossible without a clear timetable for Israeli withdrawal

items.title: 'We saved the child from drowning': In Gaza, winter storm makes displacement even deadlier
items.summary: Wind and rain are tearing apart Gaza's tents, collapsing buildings and flooding streets and shelters. With many winter supplies barred by Israel, black-market merchants are selling tents for up to $1,000. One Palestinian said, 'We don't know where we will sleep the next time it rains'

items.title: Does the US have the right to take over Greenland?
items.summary:
Donald Trump has said several times that he wants to acquire Greenland. 
But does the US have the right to take it?

items.title: Rep. Dan Goldman defends pro-Israel stance and attacks Brad Lander as New York primary poised to test Jewish voters
items.summary: The Democratic congressman used a New York Times interview to affirm his position as a moderate, pro-Israel candidate in contrast to Lander, whom he criticized for his activist tendencies

items.title: Haaretz's Bar Peleg among four Israeli reporters honored for journalistic excellence
items.summary: The 2025 Award for Journalistic Excellence, granted by the Israel Press Institute, totals 60,000 shekels (about $16,000) and will be divided among the four recipients, Bar Peleg, Roni Singer, Yossi Mizrahi and Doron Kadosh

items.title: Arab party leaders call to form joint list, oust Netanyahu 'with our own hands'
items.summary: United Arab List leader Mansour Abbas said the Arab parties 'need to stand up courageously and admit our mistakes.' Hadash-Ta'al chairman Ayman Odeh said the fight against Netanyahu 'must be one of all citizens about the way we want to live in a democratic society'

items.title: Should Israel's opposition call Netanyahu a 'traitor'?
items.summary: The words 'treason,' 'betrayal' and 'traitor' are being lobbed at the Israeli prime minister amid new developments in the Qatargate scandal. But referring to politicians as traitors in Israel has a deadly history

items.title: Huckabee takes grandkids to West Bank settlement for archaeological tour, finding 'amazing ancient coins'
items.summary: U.S. Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee has been a longtime supporter of Jewish settlements in the West Bank. An Israeli settler leader said the Huckabee family's archaeological discovery is 'the best testimony to our historical right to every part of the Land of Israel'

items.title: Life in Portugal is cheaper and calmer. But can Israelis survive there?
items.summary: Israelis who moved to Portugal before and during the war discovered a place with a very different mentality and a much lower cost of living – if you manage to keep your old Israeli job

items.title: 'Crude and illegitimate': Arab lawmaker calls for police spokesperson to be investigated over TV interview row
items.summary: Lawmaker Ahmad Tibi responded to the police's call to consider opening an investigation into him for calling the police spokesperson a 'nobody' and a 'punk' in a Monday televised interview

items.title: Investigating the Impact of US-Israeli Strikes on Iran’s Nuclear Programme
items.summary: In the early hours of June 13, Israeli missiles slammed into apartment buildings across the Iranian capital, Tehran.  By morning, it became apparent that nine men Israel said were closely associated with the country’s nuclear programme were dead.  Videos posted to social media showed build

items.title: How Russia’s Invasion is Impacting Ukraine’s Youth
items.summary: Last month, in the dead of a cold Autumn night, residents in the Ukrainian town of Balakliia were woken by the sound of two massive explosions. Social media footage showed apartments ablaze, balconies obliterated and a deep crater smouldering in a parking lot. Three people were killed and 13 injured

items.title: Profiting From Exploitation: How We Found the Man Behind Two Deepfake Porn Sites
items.summary: Content warning: This article contains descriptions of non-consensual sexual imagery. Depending on which of his social media profiles you were looking at, Mark Resan was either a marketing lead at Google or working for a dental implant company, a human resources company and a business software firm

items.summary: A joint investigation by Bellingcat and Lloyd’s List has identified Saudi Arabia as the newest country to import grain directly from a Western-sanctioned port in occupied Crimea, as Russia attempts to secure recognition of the Ukrainian territory via a US-led peace plan. items.title: From School to Battlefield to Grave: How Russian Cossacks drive young people to war
items.summary:
The All-Russian Cossack Society turns school clubs into pipelines for state-sponsored militarisation and recruitment for war in Ukraine. Bellingcat shows how they shape an alternative mobilisation force.
